oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Sunday Down South - 1945-06-17 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: WSM program Sunday Down South, sponsored by Lion Oil. Originally broadcast 1945-06-17 at 5:00 pm, part 2. Personnel include Louie Buck (host), Lionel Ricau (announcer), Beasley Smith (conductor) and the Lion Orchestra (performer) including Harold Johnson (violin), Danny Ryan (performer), Kay Carlisle (performer), and the Old Timers Quartet (performers).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Beasley Smith; Lion Orchestra; Danny Ryan; Kay Carlisle; Old Timers Quartet
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Lion Oil commercial (Lionel Ricau) -- Louie Buck introduces the next piece -- Meet Me Tonight In Dreamland (Kay Carlisle, Danny Ryan) -- Louie Buck introduces the next piece -- Wang Wang Blues (Beasley Smith and the Lion Orchestra) -- Louie Buck introduces the Old Timers Quartet -- Daddy You've Been A Mother To Me (Old Timers Quartet) -- Lion Oil commercial (Lionel Ricau) -- Louie Buck and Danny Ryan talk -- East Side Of Heaven (Danny Ryan) -- Louie Buck reads a message from the government -- Theme (Beasley Smith and the Lion Orchestra) -- Closing statement (Louie Buck)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: National Broadcasting Company; WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Sunday down south (Radio program); Bulova (Firm); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Ricau, Lionel; Smith, Beasley; Lion Orchestra (Musical group); Ryan, Danny (Vocalist); Carlisle, Kay (Vocalist); Johnson, Harold (Musician); Old Timers Quartet
